headline.main: Man Who Flew Gyrocopter to U.S. Capitol Faces Up to Nine and a Half Years in Prison
headline.print_headline: Man Who Flew Gyrocopter to U.S. Capitol Faces Up to Nine and a Half Years in Prison

docs.snippet: The Florida man who flew a gyrocopter onto the grounds of the U.S. Capitol in April faces up to 9-1/2 years in prison after being indicted by a federal grand jury on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Florida man who flew a gyrocopter onto the grounds of the U.S. Capitol in April faces up to 9-1/2 years in prison after being indicted by a federal grand jury on Wednesday.

headline.main: Human Ancestors Made Stone Tools Earlier Than Previously Known
headline.print_headline: Human Ancestors Made Stone Tools Earlier Than Previously Known

docs.snippet: Our ancient ancestors made stone tools, a milestone achievement along the path of human progress, much earlier than previously thought and far before the appearance of the first known member of our genus Homo....
docs.lead_paragraph: Our ancient ancestors made stone tools, a milestone achievement along the path of human progress, much earlier than previously thought and far before the appearance of the first known member of our genus Homo.

headline.main: Trove of new bin Laden documents suggest a tender family man fixated on attacking U.S.
headline.sub: Trove of new bin Laden documents suggest a tender family man fixated on attacking U.S.

docs.snippet: Newly-declassified documents recovered during the raid on Osama bin Laden's compound paint a picture of a tender family man, but one also fixated on attacking the U.S.. Mana Rabiee reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Newly-declassified documents recovered during the raid on Osama bin Laden's compound paint a picture of a tender family man, but one also fixated on attacking the U.S.. Mana Rabiee reports.

headline.main: Pilot Who Landed Gyrocopter at US Capitol Facing 6 Charges
headline.print_headline: Pilot Who Landed Gyrocopter at US Capitol Facing 6 Charges

docs.snippet: A Florida man who piloted a gyrocopter through miles of America's most restricted airspace before landing at the U.S. Capitol is now facing charges that carry up to 9½ years in prison....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida man who piloted a gyrocopter through miles of America's most restricted airspace before landing at the U.S. Capitol is now facing charges that carry up to 9½ years in prison.
